name: qsv-to
description: Convert CSV files to Parquet, PostgreSQL, SQLite, Excel (XLSX), LibreOffice Calc (ODS) and Data Package.

args.name: subcommand
args.description: Subcommand to execute. Valid values: datapackage, ods, parquet, postgres, sqlite, xlsx

options.description: The field delimiter for reading CSV data. Must be a single character. (default: ,)
Drop tables before loading new data into them (postgres/sqlite only).
Create database dump file for use with `psql` or `sqlite3` command line tools (postgres/sqlite only).
If loading into existing db, alter existing tables so that new data will load. (postgres/sqlite only).
For parquet, allow piping from stdin (using `-`) or from a named pipe.
Print statistics as datapackage, by default will print field summary.
The schema to load the data into. (postgres only).
For xlsx, use this character to help truncate xlsx sheet names. Defaults to space.
Produce extra statistics about the data beyond just type guessing.
Output stats as CSV to specified file.
